## Additional Learning Resources

This page provides supplementary materials and resources to deepen your understanding of DataSHIELD and OMOP CDM beyond the workshop content.

### üìö Essential Reading

::: {.row}
::: {.col-md-6}
::: {.resource-card}
<i class="bi bi-file-earmark-pdf resource-icon"></i>

#### DataSHIELD Publications

**Foundational Papers:**
- [Gaye et al. (2014)](https://doi.org/10.1093/ije/dyu188) - DataSHIELD: taking the analysis to the data, not the data to the analysis
- [Marcon et al. (2021)](https://doi.org/10.1186/s12874-021-01308-8) - Recent advances in DataSHIELD
- [Wilson et al. (2017)](https://doi.org/10.1136/bmjopen-2017-019053) - DataSHIELD tutorial

**Technical Papers:**
- Privacy-preserving data analysis methods
- Federated learning in epidemiology
- Statistical disclosure control
:::
:::

::: {.col-md-6}
::: {.resource-card}
<i class="bi bi-file-earmark-pdf resource-icon"></i>

#### OMOP CDM Literature

**Core Documentation:**
- [The Book of OHDSI](https://ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/) - Comprehensive guide to OHDSI and OMOP
- [OMOP CDM v5.4 Specifications](https://ohdsi.github.io/CommonDataModel/)
- [Vocabulary Documentation](https://www.ohdsi.org/web/wiki/doku.php?id=documentation:vocabulary)

**Research Applications:**
- Real-world evidence generation
- Network studies methodology
- Data quality frameworks
:::
:::
:::

<i class="bi bi-shield-check resource-icon"></i>

#### Privacy & Security Tools

- **SDC Tools**: Statistical disclosure control

- **Privacy Audit Tools**: Compliance checking
- **Differential Privacy Libraries**: Google, IBM
- **Secure Computing Platforms**: Various options

### üìä Datasets for Practice

::: {.resource-card}
<i class="bi bi-database resource-icon"></i>

#### Sample Datasets

**DataSHIELD Test Data:**
- **CNSIM**: Simulated cohort data (n=5,000)
- **DASIM**: Disease analysis dataset
- **SURVIVAL**: Time-to-event data

**OMOP Sample Data:**
- **Synthea OMOP**: 1K, 10K, 100K patient datasets
- **CMS SynPUF**: Synthetic Medicare data
- **MIMIC-OMOP**: Critical care data (requires DUA)

**African Health Data:**
- Workshop-specific datasets
- Demographic health surveys (anonymized)
- Disease surveillance samples
:::

### üìù Citation & Attribution

When using DataSHIELD or OMOP CDM in your research:

::: {.callout-note}
## How to Cite

**DataSHIELD:**
```
Gaye A, et al. DataSHIELD: taking the analysis to the data, 
not the data to the analysis. Int J Epidemiol. 2014;43(6):1929-44.
```

**OMOP CDM:**
```
Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics (OHDSI) Collaborative. 
The Book of OHDSI. 2021. Available from: https://ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/
```
:::
